attributes.action: Create a Parades Commission in Britain to tackle Anti-Semitic or Anti-Israeli demonstrations
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government has claimed that Britain is a multi-cultural society but there has been an ever increasing anti-Semitic and anti-Israeli presence within demonstration movements. This is un-characteristic of the Britain, Prime Minister Brown claims exists and is counter productive to equality.

This petition is an attempt to question the government’s stance on; demonstration and the policing of demonstration to ensure Anti-Semitism and fascism do not arise because of hostiles towards Israel.

As well as this, for the creation of an appropriate appeals body to be introduced, for people to express opposition to gatherings and demonstrations where Anti-Semitic views could be encouraged. Furthermore for the introduction of applications to ban meetings of these groups were there has been a history of Anti-Israeli or Anti Semitic views.
